description: Atmosphere-only time slice experiment forced by climatological monthly mean sea surface temperature (SST) for the present day, future Arctic sea ice concentration (SIC) and future Arctic sea ice thickness (SIT). Radiative forcing to be set to present day (year 2000) levels. Time slice simulations to begin on 1st April and run for 14 months, the first two months are ignored to allow for an initial model spin up. Minimum ensemble size is 100 simulations.
long_name: Atmosphere time slice with present day SST and future Arctic SIC and sea ice thickness
rationale: Investigate role of sea ice thickness in response to Arctic sea ice.

requirements.description: Future monthly mean cimatology of arctic sea ice concentration, data provided by PAMIP. When used in coupled models it is recommended to constrain sea ice by nudging but with a weak relaxation timescale of 2 months. However, appropriately calibrated long-wave fluxes applied to the sea ice model may also be used.
requirements.keywords: PAMIP, arctic SIC clim, arctic sea ice concentration climatology, future
requirements.label: PAMIP future Arctic SIC

requirements.description: Future monthly mean climatology of Arctic sea ice thickness, data provided by PAMIP.  If sea ice thickness cannot be specified then it should be left free to evolve in the coupled model experiments.
requirements.keywords: PAMIP, SIT, sea ice thickness, climatology, future, arctic
requirements.label: PAMIP future Arctic SIT

requirements.description: An ensemble of one hundred simulations.  Initial conditions should be based on the AMIP simulation for 1st April 2000 if possible, though any suitable start dump may be used, noting that the first two months of the simulations will be ignored. The results are not expected to be particularly sensitive to the way in which ensemble members are generated, and any suitable method may be used but should be documented.
requirements.keywords: One hundred, 100, ensemble, runs, simulations, AMIP
requirements.label: 100MemberAMIP
